item.title: When you find a spare few minutes during this holiday season, take the time to watch these. Inspirational
item.description:
When you find a spare few minutes during this holiday season, take the time to watch these. Inspirational

I'm a big fan of helpful and motivational content, especially business-minded podcasts and videos of keynote speakers from conferences around the world. TED Talks, a collection of thousands of presentations from some of the most brilliant entrepreneurial minds, is my favorite source of video motivation.

item.title: At a time of year to be giving and grateful
item.description:
At a time of year to be giving and grateful

After recently interviewing several candidates to fill two entry-level positions at our company, I learned that social responsibility is a key factor in a person's decision to work for a company. I had always felt that giving back and doing good were important, but it was not until recently that I understood that it had become important to many who are new to the workforce, namely Millennials.

item.title: Top entrepreneur a cut above
item.description:
Top entrepreneur a cut above

A Hastings businessman who started a meat processing company more than three decades ago has taken out New Zealand's top entrepreneur award. Progressive Meats founder Craig Hickson was selected from a field of six New Zealand entrepreneurs to be named EY Entrepreneur of the Year for 2015 at a dinner in Auckland on Thursday.

item.title: 10 Simple Steps for Starting a Business Today
item.description:
10 Simple Steps for Starting a Business Today

There's a saying that you have to "fake it till you make it," in life and in business. However, you also hear about wantrepreneurs. So what's the difference? The real difference to me is in the action. If you want to get started, but you don't know how to begin from zero, here is a simple and effective approach.

item.title: Raising the next Steve Jobs
item.description:
Raising the next Steve Jobs

If your kids are spending the weekend manning a lemonade stand, setting up a website to offer babysitting services or busily crafting goods to sell online, you may be wondering whether you're sharing a house with a budding entrepreneur. Increasing use of technology is making it easier for new ventures to spring up, run by ever-younger businesspeople.
